pullrequest.title: Fix make test before make install

content.html:
Looks like it's testing the difference between 1.4 and 1.5 and failing because 1.4 is supposed to default "use_parent_model_frame" to true. 

////////////////////////////////////////
// sdf model, version 1.4, use_parent_model_frame tag missing
// expect tag to be inserted with value true
TEST(JointAxisFrame, Version_1_4_missing)
{
  char *pathCStr = getenv("SDF_PATH");
  boost::filesystem::path path = PROJECT_SOURCE_PATH;
  path = path / "sdf" / SDF_VERSION;
  setenv("SDF_PATH", path.string().c_str(), 1);

  sdf::SDFPtr model(new sdf::SDF());
  sdf::init(model);
  ASSERT_TRUE(sdf::readString(get_sdf_string("1.4"), model));
  setenv("SDF_PATH", pathCStr, 1);

  sdf::ElementPtr joint = model->root->GetElement("model")->GetElement("joint");
  sdf::ElementPtr axis = joint->GetElement("axis");
  EXPECT_TRUE(axis->HasElement("use_parent_model_frame"));
  EXPECT_TRUE(axis->Get<bool>("use_parent_model_frame")); // <---------------------------------------------------FAILURE HERE
}

pullrequest.title: Fix make test before make install

content.raw:
It appears that:

 * a conversion is failing just before the test from 1.4 -> 1.5
 * `sdf/1.5/joint.sdf` defines the xml such that `use_parent_model_frame` will be inserted if it's missing and set to `false`
 * `sdf/1.5/1_4.convert` defines that `use_parent_model_frame` will be inserted if it's missing and set to `true`
 * `sdf/1.4/joint.sdf` does not make any determination about `use_parent_model_frame`


```
#!sh
Running main() from gtest_main.cc
[==========] Running 2 tests from 1 test case.
[----------] Global test environment set-up.
[----------] 2 tests from JointAxisFrame
[ RUN      ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_4_missing
Warning [parser.cc:345] Converting a deprecated source[data-string].
Warning [Converter.cc:59]   Version[1.4] to Version[1.5]
  Please use the gzsdf tool to update your SDF files.
    $ gzsdf convert [sdf_file]
Error [Converter.cc:127] Unable to convert from SDF version 1.4 to 1.5
/home/local/RESQUARED/andrew.somerville/projects/BESS/sandbox/sdformat/test/integration/joint_axis_frame.cc:62: Failure
Value of: axis->Get<bool>("use_parent_model_frame")
  Actual: false
Expected: true
[  FAILED  ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_4_missing (41 ms)
[ RUN      ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_5_missing
[       OK ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_5_missing (41 ms)
[----------] 2 tests from JointAxisFrame (82 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 2 tests from 1 test case ran. (82 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 1 test.
[  FAILED  ] 1 test, listed below:
[  FAILED  ] JointAxisFrame.Version_1_4_missing

 1 FAILED TEST
```

Rebuilding in debug to dive into the conversion failure.
content.html:
It appears that:

  • a conversion is failing just before the test from 1.4 -> 1.5
  • sdf/1.5/joint.sdf defines the xml such that use_parent_model_frame will be inserted if it's missing and set to false
  • sdf/1.5/1_4.convert defines that use_parent_model_frame will be inserted if it's missing and set to true
  • sdf/1.4/joint.sdf does not make any determination about use_parent_model_frame

pullrequest.title: Fix make test before make install

content.html:
Looks like:

  • sdf::Converter::Convert is diving into /usr/local/share to find converters

This appears to be because SDF.cc: sdf::findFile checks the preprocessor define SDF_SHARE_PATH before the env var SDF_PATH

  // Next check the install path.
  path = boost::filesystem::path(SDF_SHARE_PATH) / _filename;
  if (boost::filesystem::exists(path))
    return path.string();

  // Next check the versioned install path.
  path = boost::filesystem::path(SDF_SHARE_PATH) / "sdformat" /
    sdf::SDF::version / _filename;
  if (boost::filesystem::exists(path))
    return path.string();

  // Next check SDF_PATH environment variable
  char *pathCStr = getenv("SDF_PATH");
  if (pathCStr)
  {
    std::vector<std::string> paths;
    boost::split(paths, pathCStr, boost::is_any_of(":"));
    for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator iter = paths.begin();
         iter != paths.end(); ++iter)
    {
      path = boost::filesystem::path(*iter) / _filename;
      if (boost::filesystem::exists(path))
        return path.string();
    }
  }

I think this is a bug in sdf::findFile ant the checks should be re-ordered.

I'll open a bug and submit a patch.

If the test works with the search reordered, I'd say this test fix is correct.
